title: Basic Usage
text: Welcome atrrr vignette! guide delve deeper functionalities offered package- diving , let‚Äôs clarify terminology. context Blue Sky, post referred ‚Äúskeet.‚Äù , mention retrieving working ‚Äúskeets,‚Äù talking individual posts made Blue Sky. Now, let‚Äôs delve deeper functionalities allow users interact skeets, followers, descriptions.

title: Basic Usage
text: first time make request, prompted automatically enter user handle app password authenticate atrrr communicate BlueSky . page generate app passwords also automatically opened . However, can also trigger process manually: can useful want replace old token permanently stored encrypted disk.
code: auth("jbgruber.bsky.social")

title: Basic Usage
text: can search Posts Bluesky using small set operators: Whitespace treated implicit , words query must occur Double quotes indicate exact phrases :<handle> filter results account - excludes terms Note matches can occur anywhere skeet, just text. example, term can link preview, alt text image. couple examples: finds posts ‚Äúrstats‚Äù found somewhere post. finds posts hashtag ‚Äúrstats‚Äù word Bluesky somewhere skeet (ignoring capitalisaion). can also search exact phrase ‚Äúnew #rstats package‚Äù: can also limit search looking skeets one user:

title: Basic Usage
text: good starting point understanding user‚Äôs digital footprint platform. get_user_info function becomes handy tool, fetching array information user. need? handle! function gives us counts followers, follows, posts user. can also retrieve information multiple users providing vector user handles:

title: Feed Analysis

code: library(ggplot2)  # Identifying the top 10 contributors rstat_posts |>   count(handle = author_handle, sort = T) |>   slice(1:10) |>   mutate(handle = forcats::fct_reorder(handle, n)) |>   ggplot(aes(handle, n)) +   geom_col() +   coord_flip() +   theme_minimal()

title: Feed Analysis

title: Interaction with Platform
text: Media can posted using path file. can also included thread. First let‚Äôs create plots want send: Now post pictures thread:
code: # make a basic plot plot <- ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy, colour = class)) +   geom_point()  # save it to a file f1 <- ggsave(filename = tempfile(pattern = "1", fileext = ".png"), plot = plot)  # a second basic plot lty <- c("solid", "dashed", "dotted", "dotdash", "longdash", "twodash") linetypes <- data.frame(   y = seq_along(lty),   lty = lty ) plot2 <- ggplot(linetypes, aes(0, y)) +   geom_segment(aes(xend = 5, yend = y, linetype = lty)) +   scale_linetype_identity() +   geom_text(aes(label = lty), hjust = 0, nudge_y = 0.2) +   scale_x_continuous(NULL, breaks = NULL) +   scale_y_reverse(NULL, breaks = NULL)  # again we save it to a temporary file f2 <- ggsave(tempfile(pattern = "2", fileext = ".png"), plot = plot2) post_thread(texts = c("This is the first plot on the ggplot2 website",                       "This is the second plot on the ggplot2 website",                       "And this is just text sent from the atrrr package by @jbgruber.bsky.social, @benguinaudeau.bsky.social and @favstats.eu"),             images = c(f1, f2, ""),             image_alts = c("first ggplot2 plot",                            "second ggplot2 plot",                            ""))

Extracting posts from this curated feed rstat_posts <- get_feed(rstat_feed$uri, limit = 200) |>   dplyr::glimpse() #> Rows: 292 #> Columns: 20 #> $ uri           <chr> "at://did:plc:7crs3axm67jhrc57gi7ojyjn/app.bsky.feed.pos‚Ä¶ #> $ cid           <chr> "bafyreicru2iryln3mqm6skdhym4illw2kn6z7qqig34trfvsp72zyi‚Ä¶ #> $ author_handle <chr> "timbulwidodostp.bsky.social", "bigbookofr.bsky.social",‚Ä¶ #> $ author_name   <chr> "Timbul Widodo, S.TP", "Big Book of R", "Craig Hamilton"‚Ä¶ #> $ text          <chr> "Sequential analysis poisson binomial data g estimation ‚Ä¶ #> $ author_data   <list> ["did:plc:7crs3axm67jhrc57gi7ojyjn", "timbulwidodostp.b‚Ä¶ #> $ post_data     <list> ["app.bsky.feed.post", "2024-11-16T13:08:30.723Z", [[[[‚Ä¶ #> $ embed_data    <list> <NULL>, <NULL>, <NULL>, ["app.bsky.embed.record#view", ‚Ä¶ #> $ reply_count   <int> 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 2, 0, 0, 1, 2, 1, 0, 0, 3, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0,‚Ä¶ #> $ repost_count  <int> 0, 0, 0, 3, 0, 19, 0, 1, 0, 2, 1, 4, 0, 11, 0, 0, 1, 0, ‚Ä¶ #> $ like_count    <int> 0, 0, 0, 3, 1, 37, 0, 3, 1, 4, 1, 14, 1, 21, 1, 1, 4, 5,‚Ä¶ #> $ indexed_at    <dttm> 2024-11-16 13:08:30, 2024-11-16 12:31:26, 2024-11-16 12‚Ä¶ #> $ in_reply_to   <chr> NA, NA, "at://did:plc:ntd53albt5ffa4rgervvgibd/app.bsky.‚Ä¶ #> $ in_reply_root <chr> NA, NA, "at://did:plc:ntd53albt5ffa4rgervvgibd/app.bsky.‚Ä¶ #> $ quotes        <chr> NA, NA, NA, "at://did:plc:ntd53albt5ffa4rgervvgibd/app.b‚Ä¶ #> $ tags          <list> <"RStats", "rstats", "rsoftware", "rstatistics">, <NULL‚Ä¶ #> $ mentions      <list> <NULL>, <NULL>, <NULL>, <NULL>, <NULL>, <NULL>, <NULL>,‚Ä¶ #> $ links         <list> <NULL>, <NULL>, <NULL>, <NULL>, <NULL>, <NULL>, <NULL>,‚Ä¶ #> $ langs         <list> ["en"], <NULL>, ["en"], ["en"], ["en"], ["en"], <NULL>,‚Ä¶ #> $ labels        <list> [], [], [], [], [], [], [], [], [], [], [], [], [], [],‚Ä¶

title: Wrapper for the AT Protocol Behind Bluesky
text: Start Basic Usage vignette learn .

title: Wrapper for the AT Protocol Behind Bluesky
text: can help creating issue requesting new features reporting bugs. developer, happy accept pull requests. fairly straightforward, endpoints already covered automatically generated function. example, endpoint app.bsky.actor.getProfiles accessible via atrrr:::app_bsky_actor_get_profiles(). function get_user_info() just thin wrapper around calls optional parsing function: find endpoint https://docs.bsky.app/docs/category/http-reference interests , can write similar wrapper contribute package (build something new top ). please open issue first, don‚Äôt duplicated work.
code: get_user_info <- function(actor,                           parse = TRUE,                           .token = NULL) {    # we need to use do.call so objects are passed to the right environment   res <- do.call(      what = app_bsky_actor_get_profiles,     args = list(       actor,       .token = .token, # tokens are handled automatically under the hood       .return = "json"     )) |>     purrr::pluck("profiles")    if (parse) {     res <- parse_actors(res)   }   return(res) }

title: Authenticate for the API ‚Äî auth
text: user user handle (e.g, benguinaudeau.bsky.social). password app password (usually created https://bsky.app/settings/app-passwords). domain now https://bsky.app/, change future. verbose Whether print status messages Console (TRUE/FALSE). Package default (NULL) status messages. Can changed Sys.setenv(ATR_VERBOSE =   FALSE). overwrite TRUE, overwrites old token without asking confirmation. token (Stale) token object. Usually need use . manage tokens get stale, can use parameter request fresh token.

title: Authenticate for the API ‚Äî auth
text: requesting token, saved location returned file.path(tools::R_user_dir("atrrr", "cache"), Sys.getenv("BSKY_TOKEN", unset = "token.rds")). multiple tokens, can use Sys.setenv(BSKY_TOKEN = "filename.rds") save/load token different name.

title: Authenticate for the API ‚Äî auth
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # request a token auth() # this will guide you through all steps  # the token is stored in the location returned by this command file.path(tools::R_user_dir("atrrr", "cache"),           Sys.getenv("BSKY_TOKEN", unset = "token.rds"))  # to use a different than the default file name for the token, set BSKY_TOKEN Sys.setenv(BSKY_TOKEN = "identity-2.rds")  # now either rename your token file or request a new token auth()  # the cache now contains two tokens list.files(tools::R_user_dir("atrrr", "cache"))  # functions that interact with the API also take a .token argument with the # path. For example: tok_path <- file.path(tools::R_user_dir("atrrr", "cache"), "identity-2.rds") get_skeets_authored_by(actor = "benguinaudeau.bsky.social", parse = TRUE,                        .token = tok_path) } # }

title: Post a skeet ‚Äî post
text: text Text post in_reply_to URL URI skeet reply . quote URL URI skeet quote. image, video path image video post. image_alt alt text image. link instead adding link text (gets parsed automatically), also possible add link directly (save characters). created_at time stamp post. labels can used label post, example "!-unauthenticated", "porn", "sexual", "nudity", "graphic-media". langs indicates human language(s) (3) post's primary text content. tags additional hashtags, addition included post text facets. preview_card display preview card links included text link (images videos included, take precedence). verbose Whether print status messages Console (TRUE/FALSE). Package default (NULL) status messages. Can changed Sys.setenv(ATR_VERBOSE =   FALSE). .token manage tokens, can supply . Usually NULL OK automatically load guide generate token. post_url URL URI post delete.

title: Search Posts ‚Äî search_post
code: search_post(   q,   limit = 100L,   sort = NULL,   since = NULL,   until = NULL,   mentions = NULL,   author = NULL,   lang = NULL,   domain = NULL,   url = NULL,   tag = NULL,   parse = TRUE,   verbose = NULL,   .token = NULL )  search_skeet(   q,   limit = 100L,   sort = NULL,   since = NULL,   until = NULL,   mentions = NULL,   author = NULL,   lang = NULL,   domain = NULL,   url = NULL,   tag = NULL,   parse = TRUE,   verbose = NULL,   .token = NULL )

title: Search Posts ‚Äî search_post
text: q search query. See Details. limit Maximum number records return. queries 100 results, pagination used automatically (one request per 100 results). function stops limit reached, usually get items requested. sort string. Specifies ranking order results. Possible values "top" "latest". Defaults "latest". since string. Filter results posts specified datetime (inclusive). Can date datetime object string can parsed either. string. Filter results posts specified datetime (inclusive). Can date datetime object string can parsed either. mentions string. Filter posts mention given account. matches rich-text facet mentions. author string. Filter posts authored specified account. lang string. Filter results posts specified language. Language detection expected use post's language field, though server may override detection. domain string. Filter results posts containing URLs (links embeds) pointing specified domain. Hostname normalization may apply. url string. Filter results posts containing links embeds matching specified URL. URL normalization fuzzy matching may apply. tag string. Filter results posts containing specified tag (hashtag). include hash (#) prefix. Multiple tags can specified, results matching specified tags (logical ). parse Parse results return original nested object sent server. verbose Whether print status messages Console (TRUE/FALSE). Package default (NULL) status messages. Can changed Sys.setenv(ATR_VERBOSE =   FALSE). .token manage tokens, can supply . Usually NULL OK automatically load guide generate token.

title: Search Posts ‚Äî search_post
text: data frame (nested list) posts

title: Search Posts ‚Äî search_post
text: API docs claim Lucene query syntax supported (Boolean operators brackets complex queries). small subset actually implemented: Whitespace treated implicit , words query must occur, word order proximity ignored. Double quotes indicate exact phrases. :<handle> filter results account. - excludes terms (seem working moment). Note matches can occur anywhere skeet, just text. example, term can link preview, alt text image.

title: Search Posts ‚Äî search_post
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ search_post("rstats") # finds post with the hashtag rstats AND the word Bluesky somewhere in the # skeet (ignoring capitalisaion) search_post("#rstats Bluesky")  # search for the exact phrase "new #rstats package" search_post("\"new #rstats package\"") # Use single quotes so you do not need to escape double quotes search_post('"new #rstats package"')  # only search for skeets from one user search_post("from:jbgruber.bsky.social #rstats")  # narrow down the search with more parameters search_post("{atrrr}",             sort = "top",             since = "2024-12-05",             until = "2024-12-07 10:00:00",             mentions = NULL,             author = "jbgruber.bsky.social",             domain = "jbgruber.github.io",             url = "https://jbgruber.github.io/atrrr",             tag = "rstats") } # }

title: atrrr 0.0.5
text: CRAN release: 2025-01-19 adds three new functions lists: get_list(), get_list_feed(), get_starter_pack() adapted httr2 1.1.0 now supports posting videos,several images compresses images large updated auto functions reflect changes endpoints added new parameters search_post() improves stability preview cards posts improves parsing actor data

title: atrrr 0.0.4
